author: Enayat Rajabi

resources.description:
We exposed a subset of learning object metadata in the ODS repository, whose schema are according to the ODS Application Profile (an extended version of IEEE LOM satandard). This subset includes around 15,000 sample metadata records exposed as Linked Data around 320,000 triples. The format of the RDF exposed follows the recommendations elaborated as part of the ODS project that can be found here. The most used metadata elements for exposure are the following:
Learning object identifier [General.Identifier] as dcterms:identifier
Title of learning object as dcterms:title
Keywords of learning object as lom:keyword
Actual location of learning object as lom:technicalLocation
Learning object description as dcterms:description
resources.name: ODS sample RDF dump

resources.description: Two examples are the ODS resources from different repositories are provided in this page
resources.name: Sample ODS resource

organization.description:
The Information Engineering (IE) research unit of university of Alcala (Spain) was established officially in 2004 as a research group at the Computer Science Department - University of Alcal√°.
IE mission is that of becoming a high productivity R&D group and mediator, with an emphasis on engineering Information Systems in the organizational context. The group has extensive experience in ontology engineering, Semantic Web development, learning technology, social network analysis, machine learning, soft computing and empirical approaches to Software Engineering.
organization.title: UAH
organization.name: uah

name: ods
notes: Open Discovery Space intends to facilitate of the implementation of the Action 68 of the Digital Agenda for Europe and to effectively modernize education in the EU, for all subjects and skills. For this, Open Discovery Space aims to unleash the innovation potential of Europe in the production of novel educational and training activities through efficient use of ICT combined with effective stakeholder engagement. Stakeholders to be engaged in the Open Discovery Space innovation generation process include students, teachers, parents, policy makers, and, where appropriate, vendors of eLearning resources.
title: Open Discovery Space (ODS)
